description.narrative: The Australia-India Strategic Research Fund is a jointly managed program by the Government of Australia and Government of India aimed at supporting collaborative, leading-edge research between scientists in India and Australia across a range of agreed priority areas. The objectives of the AISRF are to: increase the uptake of leading science and technology by supporting collaboration between Australian and Indian researchers in strategically focused, leading-edge scientific research and technology projects; strengthen strategic alliances between Australian and Indian researchers; and facilitate Australia’s and India’s access to the global science and technology system. Funding included under this investment represents Official Development Assistance (ODA) related expenditure. The non-aid component is funded by the Australian Department of Industry and Science and reported separately as Other Official Flows (OOF). The total value of the ODA is up to $10.0 million over 4 years, starting i
